name: Baby Names Data
title: Baby Names Data

api_list.name: /gender
api_list.description: The 'gender' endpoint from the 'BabyNamesData' API provides a list of possible values for the gender field. Gender refers to the categorization of individuals as either male or female. This endpoint allows users to access a comprehensive array of string values that represent the various genders available in the dataset. Each string value represents a distinct gender category, without any duplication. The endpoint ensures a user-friendly approach by presenting the options clearly and concisely. It helps users understand the available gender options within the dataset, which can be useful for analyzing and organizing baby name data based on gender preferences.

api_list.name: /childsFirstName
api_list.description: The endpoint 'childsFirstName' from the API 'BabyNamesData' provides a convenient way to explore an extensive collection of potential first names for children. When you make a request to this endpoint, it returns an array of strings representing various options for the field 'childsFirstName'. Each string within the array signifies a unique name that parents might consider when naming their child.By utilizing this endpoint, you can easily access a vast database of diverse name choices. Whether you're looking for traditional names, modern and unique options, or even trending names, this endpoint provides a comprehensive list to suit your preferences. With a wide array of possibilities, you can save valuable time and effort in searching for the perfect name for your child.The endpoint 'childsFirstName' allows users to explore and gather inspiration from an extensive collection of potential first names in a user-friendly manner, ensuring a convenient and personalized experience for expecting parents or anyone interested in discovering new names.

api_list.name: /ethnicity
api_list.description: The 'ethnicity' endpoint in the BabyNamesData API provides a list of all the different ethnicities that are associated with the baby names data. It returns an array of strings, where each string represents a distinct ethnicity category. These categories help identify the ethnic origins or backgrounds of the individuals associated with the recorded baby names.For example, the endpoint may return values like African American, Asian, Hispanic, Native American, or White. These ethnicity categories provide insights into the diversity and representation of different ethnic groups within the dataset.By accessing the 'ethnicity' endpoint, users can obtain a comprehensive list of the available ethnicities in the baby names data. This information can be useful for analyzing naming trends and patterns across different ethnic groups or understanding the cultural diversity reflected in the given dataset.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the heart of the BabyNamesData API. It is where all the magic happens! When you send a query to this endpoint, it fetches and returns a delightful array of objects, each representing a row of baby name records associated with the specified query parameters.Imagine you are curious to explore the vast world of baby names. You can make use of the 'records' endpoint to discover a treasure trove of information. By inputting certain query parameters, you can customize your search and retrieve just the right set of data that suits your needs.Whether you are a parent-to-be, a researcher, or simply fascinated by names, the 'records' endpoint provides an incredible array of possibilities. It opens up a doorway to explore trends, historical data, and popularity of names over time.Unleash your imagination and embark on a fascinating journey through generations of baby names with the 'records' endpoint of the BabyNamesData API. Your exploration awaits!

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the 'BabyNamesData' API provides an array of strings containing various values. This endpoint is particularly useful in understanding and analyzing the data related to baby names. Each value within the array represents a specific index or identifier for a particular dataset within the API. These indexes enable easy navigation and retrieval of specific baby name data subsets.For instance, if you were interested in finding information about the popularity, meaning, or origin of certain baby names, you could utilize these indexes to access relevant datasets. By making requests to the 'dataListIndex' endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of all available indexes, which serve as a key to accessing distinct datasets.With this endpoint, developers and users can efficiently explore and extract desired baby name data to gain insights, perform statistical analyses, or develop applications based on the information provided by the 'BabyNamesData' API.

api_list.name: /rank
api_list.description: The 'rank' endpoint in the BabyNamesData API provides an array of strings representing the possible values for the field 'rank'. Rank refers to the position or numerical order given to a particular name based on its popularity within a certain context, such as baby names within a specific year or region. By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain an array of these rank values. These values can range from the most popular ones, such as '1', to less common ones like '1000' or even '9999' depending on the dataset. Each value represents a different level of popularity for names within the specified context. This endpoint allows users to gather insights and analyze trends in naming patterns, understanding which names are more commonly chosen during specific periods or regions. With this information, it becomes easier to track the popularity and ranking of various names over time, providing valuable data for researchers, parents, or anyone interested in exploring the fascinating world of baby names.

api_list.name: /count
api_list.description: The 'count' endpoint in the BabyNamesData API provides a range of numerical values that represent the frequency or occurrence of a particular baby name within a given dataset. These values indicate how many times a specific name has been recorded or reported. This endpoint returns an array of strings, each representing a unique count value. These counts help users understand the popularity or prevalence of different names. For example, if 'count' returns the value '27' for a specific name, it means that name has been registered or recorded 27 times within the dataset.By accessing this endpoint, users can explore and analyze the popularity trends of various baby names. This information could be useful for parents looking to choose a popular or unique name for their child or for researchers studying naming patterns and cultural influences.

api_list.name: /yearOfBirth
api_list.description: The 'yearOfBirth' endpoint from the 'BabyNamesData' API provides a collection of potential values for the birth year of babies. This endpoint returns an array of strings representing different years in which babies might have been born. For instance, it could include years like 2000, 1995, or 2019. The purpose of this endpoint is to offer a range of possible birth years that can be utilized for various purposes. By integrating this endpoint into an application or system, users can access a comprehensive list of potential birth years for analyzing baby name trends, generating statistics, or conducting research related to birth cohorts.
